chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (8th Offense) and Operating w/ PAC (8th Offense). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (8th Offense) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (8th Offense) was dismissed by the court.

  • Eric G. Paquette was found guilty of OWI (8th Offense), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, establishment/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license or IID installed.
Comply with IID rules.

Any conditions/programming per agent.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge if not already done.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 14CF445.
